I am a Senior Statistician and postdoctoral researcher with a demonstrated history of working in academic research and the government relations industry. I am skilled in machine learning, omics, genetics, advanced visualization, big data analytics, environmental statistics, report writing, modeling, R and python programming. I am a research professional with a Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) focused in Statistics from Utah State University and currently working on a postdoc in cancer research at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health and the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute Department of Data Science. I am passionate about providing practical solutions to scientific problems through research.
